title: Effect of a member's dissociation
context: ยง428-603 Effect of a member&rsquo;s dissociation. (a) Upon a member&rsquo;s dissociation from a limited liability company: (1) In an at-will company, the company shall cause the dissociated member&rsquo;s company interest to be purchased under part VII; and (2) In a company having a specified term: (A) If the company dissolves and winds up its business on or before the expiration of its specified term, part VIII applies to determine the dissociated member&rsquo;s rights to distributions; and (B) If the company does not dissolve and wind up its business on or before the expiration of its specified term, the company must cause the dissociated member&rsquo;s distributional interest to be purchased under part VII on the date of the expiration of the term specified at the time of the member&rsquo;s dissociation. (b) Upon a member&rsquo;s dissociation from a limited liability company: (1) The member&rsquo;s right to participate in the management and conduct of the company&rsquo;s business terminates, except as provided in section 428-803, and the member ceases to be a member and is treated the same as a transferee; (2) The member&rsquo;s duty of loyalty under section 428-409(b)(3) terminates; and (3) The member&rsquo;s duty of loyalty under section 428-409(b)(1) and (2) and duty of care under section 428-409&copy; continue only with regard to matters arising and events occurring prior to the member&rsquo;s dissociation, unless the member participates in winding up the company&rsquo;s business pursuant to section 428-803.
